intro: Sarcanthus rostratus, commonly known as the rostrate spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive, lance-shaped form. Sarcanthus rostratus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
